# PanicOnRails

> Free, open-source browser-based train track planner and sandbox simulation with Kato N-Scale accuracy.

PanicOnRails is a web application for designing model train layouts and simulating train operations entirely in the browser. It requires no installation, no account, and is 100% free under the MIT license.

## Key Information

- **URL**: [https://panic-on-rails.chayuto.com/](https://panic-on-rails.chayuto.com/)
- **Source Code**: [https://github.com/chayuto/panic-on-rails](https://github.com/chayuto/panic-on-rails)
- **License**: MIT
- **Author**: Chayuto
- **Cost**: Free, no ads, no subscriptions

## Features

- Browser-based train track planner â€” no download or installation required
- Kato N-Scale track geometry with real-world accuracy (1:160 scale)
- Graph-based train simulation with multiple trains running simultaneously
- Snap-to-connect track placement with automatic alignment
- Export and import layouts as JSON files
- Auto-save to browser local storage
- Template library with pre-built layouts
- Dark theme interface optimized for extended use
- Keyboard shortcuts for efficient editing
- Touch and tablet support

## Technology

- React 19, TypeScript 5.9, Vite 7
- HTML5 Canvas rendering via React-Konva
- Zustand state management
- Deployed on GitHub Pages
